info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 7:18PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hamilton and central Fulton Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 717 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Caroga Lake Public Campground, or 7 miles northwest of Gloversville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gloversville, Mayfield, Caroga Lake, Cranberry Creek, Caroga Lake Public Campground, Northampton Beach Public Campground, Bleecker, Benson, Meco, Sweets Crossing, Pinnacle, Rockwood, Broadalbin Junction, Tomantown, Eppie Corners, Jackson Summit, West Bush, Smiths Corners, Riceville and North Bush. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern New York.
